page.title: 01NAIRN:THE AREA
page.content: This area lies to the West of the town and consists of a variety of housing areas from substantial 19th century sandstone villas to modern terraced,semi-detached and detached bungalows. Outside the town is fairly fertile farmland given over mainly to cereals which have been very much on the increase in the past few years. The farms are traditional buildings of slate and stone with typical additions of silos with steel and concrete sheds. There are considerable areas of woodland usually on the poorer soils and often sheltering very large formal houses.In some areas modern housing is invading the edge of the woodland. The main Aberdeen to Inverness trunk road bisects the area and is becoming increasingly busy.
